Air Freight
description: The Air Freight data set is a ray-traced image sequence along with ground truth segmentation based on textural characteristics. (455 images + GT, each 160x120 pixels). (Formats: PNG)

name: Amsterdam Library of Object Images
description: ALOI is a color image collection of one-thousand small objects, recorded for scientific purposes. In order to capture the sensory variation in object recordings, we systematically varied viewing angle, illumination angle, and illumination color for each object, and additionally captured wide-baseline stereo images. We recorded over a hundred images of each object, yielding a total of 110,250 images for the collection. (Formats: png)

name: Annotated face, hand, cardiac & meat images
description: Most images & annotations are supplemented by various ASM/AAM analyses using the AAM-API. (Formats: bmp,asf)

name: Brown University Stimuli
description: A variety of datasets including geons, objects, and "greebles". Good for testing recognition algorithms. (Formats: pict)

name: CAVIAR video sequences of mall and public space behavior
description: 90K video frames in 90 sequences of various human activities, with XML ground truth of detection and behavior classification (Formats: MPEG2 & JPEG)

name: CCITT Fax standard images
description: 8 images (Formats: gif)

name: CMU CIL's Stereo Data with Ground Truth
description: 3 sets of 11 images, including color tiff images with spectroradiometry (Formats: gif, tiff)

name: CMU PIE Database
description: A database of 41,368 face images of 68 people captured under 13 poses, 43 illuminations conditions, and with 4 different expressions.

name: CMU VASC Image Database
description: Images, sequences, stereo pairs (thousands of images) (Formats: Sun Rasterimage)

name: Caltech Image Database
description: about 20 images - mostly top-down views of small objects and toys. (Formats: GIF)

name: Columbia-Utrecht Reflectance and Texture Database
description: Texture and reflectance measurements for over 60 samples of 3D texture, observed with over 200 different combinations of viewing and illumination directions. (Formats: bmp)

name: Computational Colour Constancy Data
description: A dataset oriented towards computational color constancy, but useful for computer vision in general. It includes synthetic data, camera sensor data, and over 700 images. (Formats: tiff)

name: Content-based image retrieval database
description: 11 sets of color images for testing algorithms for content-based retrieval. Most sets have a description file with names of objects in each image. (Formats: jpg)

name: Densely Sampled View Spheres
description: Densely sampled view spheres - upper half of the view sphere of two toy objects with 2500 images each. (Formats: tiff)

name: Digital Embryos
description: Digital embryos are novel objects which may be used to develop and test object recognition systems. They have an organic appearance. (Formats: various formats are available on request)

name: El Salvador Atlas of Gastrointestinal VideoEndoscopy
description: Images and Videos of his-res of studies taken from Gastrointestinal Video endoscopy. (Formats: jpg, mpg, gif)

name: FG-NET Facial Aging Database
description: Database contains 1002 face images showing subjects at different ages. (Formats: jpg)

name: FVC2000 Fingerprint Databases
description: FVC2000 is the First International Competition for Fingerprint Verification Algorithms. Four fingerprint databases constitute the FVC2000 benchmark (3520 fingerprints in all).

name: Biometric Systems Lab
description: University of Bologna

name: Face and Gesture images and image sequences
description: Several image datasets of faces and gestures that are ground truth annotated for benchmarking

name: German Fingerspelling Database
description: The database contains 35 gestures and consists of 1400 image sequences that contain gestures of 20 different persons recorded under non-uniform daylight lighting conditions. (Formats: mpg,jpg)

name: Groningen Natural Image Database
description: 4000+ 1536x1024 (16 bit) calibrated outdoor images (Formats: homebrew)

name: ICG Testhouse sequence
description: 2 turntable sequences from ifferent viewing heights, 36 images each, resolution 1000x750, color (Formats: PPM)

name: Institute of Computer Graphics and Vision
IEN Image Library
description: 1000+ images, mostly outdoor sequences (Formats: raw, ppm)

name: INRIA's Syntim images database
description: 15 color image of simple objects (Formats: gif)

name: INRIA's Syntim stereo databases
description: 34 calibrated color stereo pairs (Formats: gif)

name: Image Analysis Laboratory
description: Images obtained from a variety of imaging modalities -- raw CFA images, range images and a host of "medical images". (Formats: homebrew)

name: Image Database
description: An image database including some textures

name: JAFFE Facial Expression Image Database
description: The JAFFE database consists of 213 images of Japanese female subjects posing 6 basic facial expressions as well as a neutral pose. Ratings on emotion adjectives are also available, free of charge, for research purposes. (Formats: TIFF Grayscale images.)

name: MIT Vision Texture
description: Image archive (100+ images) (Formats: ppm)

name: Machine Vision
description: Images from the textbook by Jain, Kasturi, Schunck (20+ images) (Formats: GIF TIFF)

name: Mammography Image Databases
description: 100 or more images of mammograms with ground truth. Additional images available by request, and links to several other mammography databases are provided. (Formats: homebrew)

name: ftp://ftp.cps.msu.edu/pub/prip
description: many images (Formats: unknown)

name: Middlebury Stereo Data Sets with Ground Truth
description: Six multi-frame stereo data sets of scenes containing planar regions. Each data set contains 9 color images and subpixel-accuracy ground-truth data. (Formats: ppm)

name: Middlebury Stereo Vision Research Page
description: Middlebury College

name: Modis Airborne simulator, Gallery and data set
description: High Altitude Imagery from around the world for environmental modeling in support of NASA EOS program (Formats: JPG and HDF)

name: NLM HyperDoc Visible Human Project
description: Color, CAT and MRI image samples - over 30 images (Formats: jpeg)

name: National Design Repository
description: Over 55,000 3D CAD and solid models of (mostly) mechanical/machined engineerign designs. (Formats: gif,vrml,wrl,stp,sat)

name: OSU (MSU) 3D Object Model Database
description: several sets of 3D object models collected over several years to use in object recognition research (Formats: homebrew, vrml)

name: OSU (MSU/WSU) Range Image Database
description: Hundreds of real and synthetic images (Formats: gif, homebrew)

name: OSU/SAMPL Database: Range Images, 3D Models, Stills, Motion Sequences
description: Over 1000 range images, 3D object models, still images and motion sequences (Formats: gif, ppm, vrml, homebrew)

name: Signal Analysis and Machine Perception Laboratory
Otago Optical Flow Evaluation Sequences
description: Synthetic and real sequences with machine-readable ground truth optical flow fields, plus tools to generate ground truth for new sequences. (Formats: ppm,tif,homebrew)

name: ftp://ftp.limsi.fr/pub/quenot/opflow/testdata/piv/
description: Real and synthetic image sequences used for testing a Particle Image Velocimetry application. These images may be used for the test of optical flow and image matching algorithms. (Formats: pgm (raw))

name: Photometric 3D Surface Texture Database
description: This is the first 3D texture database which provides both full real surface rotations and registered photometric stereo data (30 textures, 1680 images). (Formats: TIFF)

name: SEQUENCES FOR OPTICAL FLOW ANALYSIS (SOFA)
description: 9 synthetic sequences designed for testing motion analysis applications, including full ground truth of motion and camera parameters. (Formats: gif)

name: Sequences for Flow Based Reconstruction
description: synthetic sequence for testing structure from motion algorithms (Formats: pgm)

name: Stereo Images with Ground Truth Disparity and Occlusion
description: a small set of synthetic images of a hallway with varying amounts of noise added. Use these images to benchmark your stereo algorithm. (Formats: raw, viff (khoros), or tiff)

name: Stuttgart Range Image Database
description: A collection of synthetic range images taken from high-resolution polygonal models available on the web (Formats: homebrew)

name: The AR Face Database
description: Contains over 4,000 color images corresponding to 126 people's faces (70 men and 56 women). Frontal views with variations in facial expressions, illumination, and occlusions. (Formats: RAW (RGB 24-bit))

name: The MIT-CSAIL Database of Objects and Scenes
description: Database for testing multiclass object detection and scene recognition algorithms. Over 72,000 images with 2873 annotated frames. More than 50 annotated object classes. (Formats: jpg)

name: The RVL SPEC-DB (SPECularity DataBase)
description: A collection of over 300 real images of 100 objects taken under three different illuminaiton conditions (Diffuse/Ambient/Directed). -- Use these images to test algorithms for detecting and compensating specular highlights in color images. (Formats: TIFF )

name: The Xm2vts database
description: The XM2VTSDB contains four digital recordings of 295 people taken over a period of four months. This database contains both image and video data of faces.

name: Centre for Vision, Speech and Signal Processing
Traffic Image Sequences and 'Marbled Block' Sequence
description: thousands of frames of digitized traffic image sequences as well as the 'Marbled Block' sequence (grayscale images) (Formats: GIF)

name: U Oulu wood and knots database
description: Includes classifications - 1000+ color images (Formats: ppm)

name: UCID
description: an Uncompressed Colour Image Database - a benchmark database for image retrieval with predefined ground truth. (Formats: tiff)

name: UMass Vision Image Archive
description: Large image database with aerial, space, stereo, medical images and more. (Formats: homebrew)

name: USF Range Image Data with Segmentation Ground Truth
description: 80 image sets (Formats: Sun rasterimage)

name: University of Oulu Physics-based Face Database
description: contains color images of faces under different illuminants and camera calibration conditions as well as skin spectral reflectance measurements of each person.

name: Machine Vision and Media Processing Unit
University of Oulu Texture Database
description: Database of 320 surface textures, each captured under three illuminants, six spatial resolutions and nine rotation angles. A set of test suites is also provided so that texture segmentation, classification, and retrieval algorithms can be tested in a standard manner. (Formats: bmp, ras, xv)

name: View Sphere Database
description: Images of 8 objects seen from many different view points. The view sphere is sampled using a geodesic with 172 images/sphere. Two sets for training and testing are available. (Formats: ppm)

name: Wiry Object Recognition Database
description: Thousands of images of a cart, ladder, stool, bicycle, chairs, and cluttered scenes with ground truth labelings of edges and regions. (Formats: jpg)

name: Yale Face Database
description: 165 images (15 individuals) with different lighting, expression, and occlusion configurations.

name: Yale Face Database B
description: 5760 single light source images of 10 subjects each seen under 576 viewing conditions (9 poses x 64 illumination conditions). (Formats: PGM)

name: Center for Computational Vision and Control
DeepMind QA Corpus
description: Textual QA corpus from CNN and DailyMail. More than 300K documents in total. Paper for reference.

name: YouTube-8M Dataset
description: YouTube-8M is a large-scale labeled video dataset that consists of 8 million YouTube video IDs and associated labels from a diverse vocabulary of 4800 visual entities.

name: Open Images dataset
description: Open Images is a dataset of ~9 million URLs to images that have been annotated with labels spanning over 6000 categories.

name: Nvidia DIGITS
description: a web app based on Caffe

name: Neon
description: Python based Deep Learning Framework

name: Keras
description: Theano based Deep Learning Library

name: Chainer
description: A flexible framework of neural networks for deep learning

name: RNNLIB
description: A recurrent neural network library

name: Minerva
description: a fast and flexible tool for deep learning on multi-GPU

name: Brainstorm
description: Fast, flexible and fun neural networks.

name: Tensorflow
description: Open source software library for numerical computation using data flow graphs

name: DMTK
description: Microsoft Distributed Machine Learning Tookit

name: Scikit Flow
description: Simplified interface for TensorFlow (mimicking Scikit Learn)

name: MXnet
description: Lightweight, Portable, Flexible Distributed/Mobile Deep Learning framework

name: Veles
description: Samsung Distributed machine learning platform

name: Marvin
description: A Minimalist GPU-only N-Dimensional ConvNets Framework

name: Apache SINGA
description: A General Distributed Deep Learning Platform

description: Amazon's library for building Deep Learning models

name: SyntaxNet
description: Google's syntactic parser - A TensorFlow dependency library

name: Lasagne
